page.title: 09LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: Most of the land around and in Albury is open countryside and undulating hills. This area is not built up and is mostly grassland and forest. A 20m watertower,in a large wheat field,dominates the landscape at a height of 404ft above sea level,which is about 1.25 miles to the west of Albury Church. The thirteenth century church has a tower with diagonal buttresses with some very unusual ugly aisle windows due to the sedilias (which is a row of seats for priests to sit in) Around the church,Albury boasts some fine cottages dating from the medieval period. Three miles away at Little Hadham some terraced and semi-detatched houses can be found.
